revised_title: Evolution of Passive Continental Margins: Insights from Deep Drilling in Bay of Biscay and Rockall Plateau
tldr: During Leg 48 of the Deep Sea Drilling Project, seven holes were drilled on the margins of the Bay of Biscay and Rockall Plateau to study the evolution of passive continental margins. The geological setting and principal results of the drilling are discussed, focusing on the history of rifting and subsidence on these margins and their relation to the sea floor spreading history of the adjacent ocean basins. The findings provide insights into the nature of unconformities at passive margins and anoxic episodes during the Lower Cretaceous.
